name: exclusionist
content:
Add to word list

that excludes (= intentionally does not include) someone or something: The group had an exclusionist policy that did not allow any contact with outsiders. They are trying to get elected to parliament in order to pursue their exclusionist agenda. Related words
exclusion
exclude
More examplesFewer examplesHe has a narrow, exclusionist view of religion.I am pleased to say that the board's exclusionist policies have failed.We are challenging traditional exclusionist ideas about national identity.The report criticized the exclusionist attitudes of the clubs.There's a sort of exclusionist superiority that is sometimes associated with the myth of motherhood.

a person who does not allow someone or something to take part in something, or to enter a place: The exclusionist tends to think about people in terms of absolutes and opposites. For these exlusionists, the idea of equality was unacceptable. Related words
exclusion
exclude
More examplesFewer examplesThe ultimate goal of the exclusionists was to completely stop immigration.
